Welcome to Contacts REST API’s documentation!¶

REST API main¶

In the main.py file, the FastAPI application is initialized, including the routes, middleware, and dependencies. The uvicorn library is used to run the application.

main.read_root() → dict¶

Returns the root of the API. It is the entry point for the application. :return: dict

async main.startup() → None¶

Initializes the redis connection for fastapi-limiter. :return: None

REST API repository Contacts¶

Functions for retrieving contacts and writing them to the database

async src.repository.contacts.create(body: ContactModel, db: Session, user: User) → Contact¶

Creates a new contact for a specific user.

Parameters:

  • body (ContactModel) – The data for the contact to create.

  • db (Session) – The database session.

  • user (User) – The user to create the contact for.

Returns:

The newly created contact.

Return type:

Contact

async src.repository.contacts.delete(contact_id, db: Session, user: User) → Contact | None¶

Removes a single contact with the specified ID for a specific user. :param contact_id: The ID of the note to update. :type contact_id: int :param db: The database session. :type db: Session :param user: The user to update the contact for. :type user: User :return: The removed contact, or None if it does not exist. :rtype: Contact | None

async src.repository.contacts.favorite_update(contact_id: int, body: ContactModel, db: Session, user: User) → Contact | None¶

Updates a favorite flag of single contact with the specified ID for a specific user. :param contact_id: The ID of the note to update. :type contact_id: int :param body: The updated data for the contact. :type body: ContactModel :param db: The database session. :type db: Session :param user: The user to update the contact for. :type user: User :return: The updated contact or None if it does not exist. :rtype: Contact | None

async src.repository.contacts.get_contact_by_email(email: str, db: Session, user: User) → Contact | None¶

Retrieves a single contact with the specified email for a specific user.

Parameters:

  • email (str) – The email of the contact to retrieve.

  • db (Session) – The database session.

  • user (User) – The user to retrieve the contact for.

Returns:

The contact with the specified email, or None if it does not exist.

Return type:

Contact | None

async src.repository.contacts.get_contact_by_id(contact_id: int, db: Session, user: User) → Contact | None¶

Retrieves a single contact with the specified ID for a specific user.

Parameters:

  • contact_id (int) – The ID of the contact to retrieve.

  • db (Session) – The database session.

  • user (User) – The user to retrieve the contact for.

Returns:

The contact with the specified ID, or None if it does not exist.

Return type:

Contact | None

async src.repository.contacts.get_contacts(user: User, db: Session, skip: int, limit: int, favorite: bool | None = None) → List[Type[Contact]]¶

Retrieves a list of contacts for a specific user with specified pagination parameters

Parameters:

  • user (User) – The user to retrieve contacts for.

  • db (Session) – The database session.

  • skip (int) – The number of contacts to skip.

  • limit (int) – The maximum number of contacts to return.

  • favorite (bool) – Favorite contact flag.

Returns:

A list of contacts.

Return type:

List[Type[Contact]]

async src.repository.contacts.search_birthday(par: dict, db: Session, user: User) → List[Type[Contact]]¶

Retrieves a list of contacts for a specific user with specified number of days ahead.

Parameters:

  • par (dict) – dictionary with number of days ahead to search for.

  • db (Session) – The database session.

  • user (User) – The user to update the contact for.

Returns:

A list of contacts with the birthday in range of given number of days.

Return type:

List[Type[Contact]]

async src.repository.contacts.search_contacts(query: str, db: Session, user: User) → List[Type[Contact]]¶

Retrieves a list of contacts for a specific user with specified query parameters

Parameters:

  • query (str) – String of fields to search for.

  • db (Session) – The database session.

  • user (User) – The user to update the contact for.

Returns:

A list of contacts.

Return type:

List[Type[Contact]]

async src.repository.contacts.update(contact_id: int, body: ContactModel, db: Session, user: User) → Contact | None¶

Updates a single contact with the specified ID for a specific user.

Parameters:

  • contact_id (int) – The ID of the note to update.

  • body (ContactModel) – The updated data for the contact.

  • db (Session) – The database session.

  • user (User) – The user to update the contact for.

Returns:

The updated contact or None if it does not exist.

Return type:

Contact | None

REST API repository Users¶

Functions for working with users in the database.

async src.repository.users.confirmed_email(email: str, db: Session) → None¶

Sets a user’s email confirmed status to True.

Parameters:

  • email (str) – The email of the user to update.

  • db (Session) – The database session.

Returns:

None

async src.repository.users.create_user(body: UserModel, db: Session) → User¶

Creates a new user.

Parameters:

  • body (UserModel) – The data for the user to create.

  • db (Session) – The database session.

Returns:

The newly created user.

Return type:

User

async src.repository.users.get_user_by_email(email: str, db: Session) → Type[User] | None¶

Retrieves a single user with the specified email.

Parameters:

  • email (str) – The email of the user to retrieve.

  • db (Session) – The database session.

Returns:

The user with the specified email, or None if it does not exist.

Return type:

User | None

async src.repository.users.update_avatar(email: str, url: str, db: Session) → Type[User]¶

Updates avatar of a single user with given email. :param email: The email of the user. :type email: str :param url: Link to the new avatar. :type url: str :param db: The database session. :type db: Session :return: User with updated avatar. :rtype: Type[User]

async src.repository.users.update_token(user: User, token: str | None, db: Session) → None¶

Updates token of a single user with the specified ID.

Parameters:

  • user (User) – The user to update.

  • token (str | None) – The new token for the user.

  • db (Session) – The database session.

Returns:

None

REST API routes Contacts¶

Routes for the contacts.

async src.routes.contacts.create_contact(body: ContactModel, db: Session = Depends(get_db), current_user: User = Depends(get_current_user)) → Contact¶

Create a new contact.

Parameters:

  • body (ContactModel) – parameters of the contact to create.

  • db (Session) – The database session.

  • current_user (User) – The current authenticated user.

Returns:

The created contact.

Return type:

Contact

async src.routes.contacts.favorite_update(body: ContactFavoriteModel, contact_id: int = Path(PydanticUndefined), db: Session = Depends(get_db), current_user: User = Depends(get_current_user)) → Contact¶

Update favorite status of an existing contact of current authenticated user. :param body: parameters of the contact to update. :type body: ContactModel :param contact_id: The ID of the contact to update. :type contact_id: int :param db: The database session. :type db: Session :param current_user: The current authenticated user. :type current_user: User :return: Updated contact. :rtype: Contact

async src.routes.contacts.get_contact(contact_id: int = Path(PydanticUndefined), db: Session = Depends(get_db), current_user: User = Depends(get_current_user)) → Contact¶

Get a single contact by ID.

Parameters:

  • contact_id (int) – ID of the contact to retrieve.

  • db (Session) – The database session.

  • current_user (User) – The current authenticated user.

Returns:

The contact with the specified ID.

Return type:

Contact

async src.routes.contacts.get_contacts(skip: int = 0, limit: int = Query(10), favorite: bool = None, db: Session = Depends(get_db), current_user: User = Depends(get_current_user)) → List[Type[Contact]]¶

Get a list of the current user’s contacts.

Parameters:

  • skip (int) – Number of contacts to skip.

  • limit (int) – Number of contacts to retrieve.

  • favorite (bool) – Favorite flag of the contact.

  • db (Session) – The database session.

  • current_user (User) – The current authenticated user.

Returns:

List of contacts.

Return type:

List[Type[Contact]]

async src.routes.contacts.remove_contact(contact_id: int = Path(PydanticUndefined), db: Session = Depends(get_db), current_user: User = Depends(get_current_user)) → None¶

Delete an existing contact of current authenticated user.

Parameters:

  • contact_id (int) – The ID of the contact to delete.

  • db (Session) – The database session.

  • current_user (User) – The current authenticated user.

Returns:

None

async src.routes.contacts.search_by(query: str | None = None, db: Session = Depends(get_db), current_user: User = Depends(get_current_user)) → List[Type[Contact]]¶

Search contacts by name, lastname, email.

Parameters:

  • query (Optional[str]) – Parameters of the search.

  • db (Session) – The database session.

  • current_user (User) – The current authenticated user.

Returns:

List of contacts with the specified parameters.

Return type:

List[Type[Contact]]

async src.routes.contacts.search_contacts(days: int = Query(7), skip: int = 0, limit: int = Query(10), db: Session = Depends(get_db), current_user: User = Depends(get_current_user)) → List[Type[Contact]]¶

Finds contacts with birthday in the next specified number of days.

Parameters:

  • days (int) – Number of days in the future from today.

  • skip (int) – Number of contacts to skip.

  • limit (int) – Number of contacts to retrieve.

  • db (Session) – The database session.

  • current_user (User) – The current authenticated user.

Returns:

List of contacts.

Return type:

List[Type[Contact]]

async src.routes.contacts.update_contact(body: ContactModel, contact_id: int = Path(PydanticUndefined), db: Session = Depends(get_db), current_user: User = Depends(get_current_user)) → Contact¶

Update an existing contact of current authenticated user.

Parameters:

  • body (ContactModel) – parameters of the contact to update.

  • contact_id (int) – The ID of the contact to update.

  • db (Session) – The database session.

  • current_user (User) – The current authenticated user.

Returns:

Updated contact.

Return type:

Contact

REST API routes Users¶

Routes for the users.

Get the current authenticated user.

Parameters:

current_user (User) – The current authenticated user.

Returns:

The current authenticated user.

Return type:

UserDb

async src.routes.users.update_avatar_user(file: UploadFile = File(PydanticUndefined), current_user: User = Depends(get_current_user), db: Session = Depends(get_db)) → Type[User]¶

Update the avatar of the current authenticated user.

Parameters:

  • file (UploadFile) – The avatar to update.

  • current_user (User) – The current authenticated user.

  • db (Session) – The database session.

Returns:

User with updated user.

UserDb

REST API routes Auth¶

Routes for authorization

async src.routes.auth.confirmed_email(token: str, db: Session = Depends(get_db)) → Dict¶

Confirms the email of the user.

Parameters:

  • token (str) – Email token of the user.

  • db (Session) – The database session.

Returns:

Message of the confirmation

Return type:

Dict

async src.routes.auth.login(body: OAuth2PasswordRequestForm = Depends(OAuth2PasswordRequestForm), db: Session = Depends(get_db)) → Dict¶

Function for authorizing a user.

Parameters:

  • body (OAuth2PasswordRequestForm) – The user credentials.

  • db (Session) – The database session.

Returns:

Tokens of the authorized user.

Return type:

Dict

async src.routes.auth.refresh_token(credentials: HTTPAuthorizationCredentials = Security(HTTPBearer), db: Session = Depends(get_db)) → Dict¶

Changes tokens of the authorized user.

Parameters:

  • credentials (HTTPAuthorizationCredentials) – The credentials of the user.

  • db (Session) – The database session.

Returns:

New tokens of the authorized user.

Return type:

Dict

async src.routes.auth.request_email(body: RequestEmail, background_tasks: BackgroundTasks, request: Request, db: Session = Depends(get_db)) → Dict¶

Sends confirmation email to the user.

Parameters:

  • body (RequestEmail) – dictionary containing the email and username of the user.

  • background_tasks (BackgroundTasks) – The background tasks.

  • request (Request) – The request.

  • db (Session) – The database session.

Returns:

Message of sending the confirmation email.

Return type:

Dict

async src.routes.auth.signup(body: UserModel, background_tasks: BackgroundTasks, request: Request, db: Session = Depends(get_db)) → Dict¶

Sign up a new user.

Parameters:

  • body (UserModel) – The user to create.

  • background_tasks (BackgroundTasks) – The background tasks.

  • request (Request) – The request.

  • db (Session) – The database session.

Returns:

The created user.

Return type:

Dict

service for authenticating users

str

refresh_token (str) – Refresh token to decode

Email of the user

str

Parameters:

  • db (Session) – Database connection

Returns:

Current user

Optional[User]

token (str) – token to decode

Returns:

Email of the user

str

password (str) – Password for hashing

Return type:

str

oauth2_scheme = <fastapi.security.oauth2.OAuth2PasswordBearer object>¶
pwd_context = <CryptContext>¶
r = Redis<ConnectionPool<Connection<host=localhost,port=6379,db=0>>>¶
verify_password(plain_password, hashed_password) → bool¶

Checks if the password is correct

Parameters:

  • plain_password (str) – Password to check

  • hashed_password (str) – Hashed password in database

Returns:

True if the password is correct, False otherwise

Return type:

bool
